title: As a DJ, can one play any song in their gigs? - Quora

response.answer_text: I was a party/wedding DJ and a restaurant DJ.  You obviously play to your audience. For weddings I would ask the bride and groom for any special songs and then get a playlist ready for all ages. Class Reunions would be fun because I would bring music from those high school years. The restaurant let me play what I want but I was responsible for keeping people in the bar so you have to play what they like to hear. Wish I had Mp3’s and computer when I was DJ’ing! Would be so easy now!

There’s two questions here. What’s legal to play? What will the audience allow? I can’t get into legal, other than to say depending on the nature of the gig, there may be performance licensing involved. As for the audience, you should keep in mind you’re DJing as a service. You should be aware of the audience and their expectations. What can be played for a group of friends at a party or rave might not work at a local bar or nightclub. Your role as a DJ is to understand and meet those differences.

You can play what you want. But, if you are hired as a wedding DJ, and start mixing baroque chamber music with hardcore gangsta rap, you will likely get fired on the spot. So, know your boss and know the venue and audience. They will be the limiting factors.
Of course you can but there might be different outcomes from the audience, as a DJ your job is to please yourself and if your a good one the audience will be pleased also, well maybe most of them :)
Ok Depends, on age of crowd, event theme, company that hired you for event, will you offend your customers? Do you want to get hired again?
